intro: Alafia falcata, commonly known as the sword fern, is a species of flowering plant in the family Araceae. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, including parts of Mexico and Central America. The plant features a rhizomatous growth habit with long, strap-like leaves that are typically dark green and glossy. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in an inflorescence called a spadix, surrounded by a modified leaf called a spathe. Alafia falcata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and adaptability to various growing conditions.
